title: Basic package workflow
text: Mixed model, Time Average Treament Effect (TATE) estimand, using Natural Cubic Splines (NCS) model.
code: dat_cont <- load_data(   time = "period",   cluster_id = "cluster",   individual_id = NULL,   treatment = "trt",   outcome = "outcome_cont",   data = sw_data_example ) #> Stepped wedge dataset loaded. Discrete time design with 15 clusters, 5 sequences, and 6 time points.  analysis_6 <- analyze(   dat = dat_cont,   method = "mixed",   estimand_type = "TATE",    exp_time = "NCS",   family = gaussian )  print(analysis_6) #> Treatment effect estimate: 0.026 #> Treatment effect 95% confidence interval: -0.171, 0.223 #> Converged: TRUE

title: Basic package workflow
text: loading data outcome binomial, specify names “# successes” “# trials” variables outcome argument. Mixed model, Time Average Treament Effect (TATE) estimand, using Exposure Time Indicator (ETI) model.
code: dat_binom <- load_data(   time ="period",   cluster_id = "cluster",   individual_id = NULL,   treatment = "trt",   outcome = c("numerator", "denominator"),   data = sw_data_example ) #> Stepped wedge dataset loaded. Discrete time design with 15 clusters, 5 sequences, and 6 time points. analysis_binom <- analyze(   dat = dat_binom,   method = "mixed",   family = binomial,   estimand_type = "TATE",    exp_time = "ETI") #> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')  print(analysis_binom) #> Treatment effect estimate: 0.04 #> Treatment effect 95% confidence interval: -0.051, 0.13 #> Converged: TRUE

title: Basic package workflow
text: plot_effect_curve function plots effect estimates exposure time one analyze objects.
code: IT_model <- analyze(   dat = dat_cont, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE",   estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "IT" ) ETI_model <- analyze(   dat = dat_cont, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE",    estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "ETI" ) NCS_4_model <- analyze(   dat = dat_cont, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE",   estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "NCS",    advanced = advanced(n_knots_exp = 4) )  plot_effect_curves(IT_model, NCS_4_model, ETI_model, facet_nrow = 1)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Avi Kenny. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. David Arthur. Author. Yongdong Ouyang. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny , Arthur D, Ouyang Y (2025). steppedwedge: Analyze Data Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials. R package version 1.0.0, https://avi-kenny.github.io/steppedwedge/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {steppedwedge: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials},   author = {Avi Kenny and David Arthur and Yongdong Ouyang},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://avi-kenny.github.io/steppedwedge/}, }

what: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials
title: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials
text: R package analyzing data stepped wedge cluster randomized trials

title: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials
text: steppedwedge open-source R package designed analyzing data stepped wedge cluster randomized trials. Functions given checking/visualizing datasets estimating various treatment effect parameters, including immediate treatment effect (ITE), time averaged treatment effect (TATE), point treatment effect (PTE).

title: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials
text: latest stable version steppedwedge can installed CRAN using install.packages(): current development version can installed using devtools::install_github():
code: install.packages("steppedwedge") devtools::install_github(repo="Avi-Kenny/steppedwedge")

title: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials
text: full package documentation can found https://avi-kenny.github.io/steppedwedge/.

title: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials
text: submit bug report request new feature, please submit new GitHub Issue.

what: Set advanced parameters for analysis of data from stepped wedge trials — advanced
title: Set advanced parameters for analysis of data from stepped wedge trials — advanced
text: used conjunction analyze     set parameters controlling analysis; see examples.

title: Set advanced parameters for analysis of data from stepped wedge trials — advanced
code: advanced(offset = NULL, n_knots_exp = 4, n_knots_cal = 4)

title: Set advanced parameters for analysis of data from stepped wedge trials — advanced
text: offset linear predictor offset term; see docs `lme4::lmer`. n_knots_exp integer; relevant exp_time="NCS". Specifies number knots use exposure time, including boundary knots. spline basis includes intercept, degree basis equal number knots. n_knots_cal integer; relevant cal_time="NCS". Specifies number knots use calendar time, including boundary knots. spline basis includes intercept, degree basis equal number knots.

title: Set advanced parameters for analysis of data from stepped wedge trials — advanced
text: list options

title: Set advanced parameters for analysis of data from stepped wedge trials — advanced
code: dat <- load_data(time = "period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = "outcome_bin", data = sw_data_example)  analyze(dat = dat, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE",  exp_time = "NCS", family = binomial)

what: Analyze a stepped wedge dataset — analyze
title: Analyze a stepped wedge dataset — analyze
text: Analyze stepped wedge dataset

title: Analyze a stepped wedge dataset — analyze
code: analyze(   dat,   method = "mixed",   estimand_type = "TATE",   estimand_time = c(1, max(dat$exposure_time)),   exp_time = "IT",   cal_time = "categorical",   family = stats::gaussian,   re = c("clust", "time"),   corstr = "exchangeable",   advanced = steppedwedge::advanced() )

title: Analyze a stepped wedge dataset — analyze
text: dat dataframe containing stepped wedge trial data. method character string; either "mixed", mixed-effects model, "GEE", generalized estimating equations. estimand_type One c("TATE", "PTE"); "TATE" represents time-averaged treatment effect "PTE" represents point treatment effect. estimand_time integer vector length 1 2. estimand_type="TATE", `estimand_time` must numeric vector length 2, representing start end times exposure time period average . estimand_type="PTE", `estimand_time` must numeric vector length 1, representing time period interest. See examples. exp_time One c("", "ETI", "NCS", "TEH"); model exposure time. "" encodes immediate treatment model single treatment effect parameter. "ETI" exposure time indicator model, including one indicator variable exposure time point. "NCS" uses natural cubic spline model exposure time trend. "TEH" includes random slope term model, allowing treatment effect vary timepoint. cal_time One c("categorical", "NCS", "linear", "none"); model calendar time. "categorical" uses indicator variables discrete time points, Hussey Hughes model. "NCS" uses natural cubic spline, useful datasets continuous time. "linear" uses single slope parameter. "none" assumes underlying calendar time trend. family family object; see documentation `glm`. re character vector random effects include; relevant method="mixed" used. Possible random effects include "clust" (random intercept cluster), "time" (random intercept cluster-time interaction), "ind" (random intercept individuals; appropriate cohort design used), "tx" (random treatment effect) corstr One c("independence", "exchangeable", "ar1"); relevant method="GEE" used. Defines GEE working correlation structure; see documentation `geepack::geeglm`. advanced list options returned advanced.

title: Analyze a stepped wedge dataset — analyze
text: list model object, model type string, estimand type string, numeric treatment effect estimate, numeric treatment effect standard error, treatment effect 95 list treatment effect estimates (standard errors 95 exposure timepoint, original dataframe passed `analyze()`.

title: Analyze a stepped wedge dataset — analyze
code: # Load data test_data <- load_data(time ="period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = "outcome_cont", data = sw_data_example)  # Analysis example 1: TATE estimand for exposure times 1 through 4 results_tate <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "ETI")  results_tate  # Analysis example 2: PTE estimand for exposure time 3 results_pte <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "PTE", estimand_time = 3, exp_time = "ETI")  results_pte  # Analysis example 3: TATE estimand for exposure times 1 through 4, Natural Cubic Splines model results_tate_ncs <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "NCS", advanced = advanced(n_knots_exp = 4))  results_tate_ncs  # Analysis example 4: TATE estimand for exposure times 1 through 4 with binomial outcome data # Load data test_data_bin <- load_data(time ="period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = c("numerator", "denominator"), data = sw_data_example)  results_pte_bin <- analyze(dat = test_data_bin, family = binomial, method = "mixed",  estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "ETI")  results_pte_bin

title: Create table of estimates — as_table
text: Format estimates returned analyze table

title: Create table of estimates — as_table
code: as_table(..., labels = NA)

title: Create table of estimates — as_table
text: ... One objects class "sw_analysis" returned analyze. labels character vector length equal length(list(...)) representing curve labels

title: Create table of estimates — as_table
text: table effect estimate values

title: Create table of estimates — as_table
code: # Load data test_data <- load_data(time ="period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = "outcome_cont", data = sw_data_example)  # \donttest{ IT_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "IT") ETI_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "ETI") NCS_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "NCS") TEH_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "TEH") ests_table <- as_table(IT_model, IT_model, NCS_model, TEH_model) head(ests_table) # }

what: Load and format data object — load_data
title: Load and format data object — load_data
text: Load format data object

title: Load and format data object — load_data
code: load_data(   time,   cluster_id,   individual_id = NULL,   treatment,   outcome,   exposure_time = NULL,   offset = NULL,   time_type = "discrete",   data )

title: Load and format data object — load_data
text: time character string; name numeric variable representing time. Time can either discrete continuous. cluster_id character string; name numeric variable identifying cluster. individual_id character string (optional); name numeric variable identifying individual. treatment character string; name binary variable indicating treatment. Values must either integers (0/1) Boolean (T/F). outcome Either character string vector two character strings; numeric binary outcome, single character string indicates name numeric binary outcome variable; binomial outcome data, vector two character strings indicates "# successes" variable "# trials" variable, respectively. Values outcome variable(s) must either numeric Boolean (T/F). exposure_time character string (optional); name numeric variable identifying exposure time variable. provided, package calculate exposure time automatically. offset character string (optional); name numeric variable specifying offset. time_type One c("discrete", "continuous"); whether model treats time discrete continuous. data dataframe containing stepped wedge trial data.

title: Load and format data object — load_data
text: object class sw_data

title: Load and format data object — load_data
code: example_data <- load_data(time ="period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = "outcome_cont", offset = NULL, data = sw_data_example) base::summary(example_data)

title: Plot cluster chart — plot_cluster_chart
text: Plot cluster chart

title: Plot cluster chart — plot_cluster_chart
code: plot_cluster_chart(analysis_object)

title: Plot cluster chart — plot_cluster_chart
text: analysis_object list class `sw_analysis`.

title: Plot cluster chart — plot_cluster_chart
text: list plot actual predicted outcomes cluster.

title: Plot cluster chart — plot_cluster_chart
code: # Load data test_data <- load_data(time ="period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = "outcome_cont", data = sw_data_example)  # Analyze using TATE estimand for exposure times 1 through 4 results_tate <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "ETI")  # Plot by cluster plot_cluster_chart(results_tate)

title: Plot stepped wedge design — plot_design
text: Plot stepped wedge design

title: Plot stepped wedge design — plot_design
code: plot_design(dat)

title: Plot stepped wedge design — plot_design
text: dat dataframe containing stepped wedge trial data.

title: Plot stepped wedge design — plot_design

title: Plot effect estimates by exposure time for one or more models. — plot_effect_curves
code: # Load data test_data <- load_data(time ="period", cluster_id = "cluster", individual_id = NULL, treatment = "trt", outcome = "outcome_cont", data = sw_data_example)  # \donttest{ IT_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "IT") ETI_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "ETI") NCS_4_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "NCS", advanced = advanced(n_knots_exp = 4)) TEH_model <- analyze(dat = test_data, method = "mixed", estimand_type = "TATE", estimand_time = c(1, 4), exp_time = "TEH") plot_effect_curves(IT_model, NCS_4_model, ETI_model, TEH_model, facet_nrow = 1) # }

what: steppedwedge: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials — steppedwedge-package
title: steppedwedge: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials — steppedwedge-package
text: Provide various functions tools help fit models estimating treatment effects stepped wedge cluster randomized trials. Implements methods described Kenny, Voldal, Xia, Heagerty (2022) "Analysis stepped wedge cluster randomized trials presence time-varying treatment effect", doi:10.1002/sim.9511 .

title: steppedwedge: Analyze Data from Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trials — steppedwedge-package
